document_data.caption: A depiction of Verenestra, goddess of [[dryad]]s, [[nymph]]s, and [[sylph]]s.
document_data.name: Verenestra
document_data.title: The Oak Princess{{Cite dragon/376/Realmslore: Sarifal|61}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Verenestra''' was the [[fey]] [[deity]] of female faeries, charm, and beauty. Verenestra was the daughter of [[Titania]] and one of the Inner Circle of the [[Seelie Court]].
document_data.Description: Verenestra could choose to appear as a demure, slim female nymph, dryad, or sylph. She was always barefooted, wearing only gossamer garments the size of handkerchiefs to provide her with a semblance of modesty. She stood 4′6″ (1.37 m) in height.
document_data.Personality: Verenestra was fickle, vain, and jealous; she disdained the company of other goddesses of beauty, love, or romance. However, she was also wise enough to know that the security of her worshipers was tied to the security of the fey as a whole. She was utterly loyal to the Seelie Court.
document_data.Powers:
Verenestra's avatar could cast wizard spells of the [[illusion]], [[enchantment]], and elemental (excepting fire) schools. She herself was immune to all illusion and enchantment spells, and nonmagical weapons could not harm her. In her sylph form, she could fly; in her other two forms, she could swim. She could shift between those three forms instantly, whenever she wished.

Additionally, her avatar could cast ''[[charm person]]'', ''[[emotion|emotion (calm)]]'', ''[[massmorph]]'', and ''[[pass plant]]'' at will, and ''[[liveoak]]'', ''[[mass charm]]'', ''[[turn wood]]'', and ''[[wall of thorns]]'' three times each day.
document_data.Possessions: Verenestra was known to have an enchanted [[dagger]] made of the finest silver and studded with moonstones.
document_data.Divine Realm:
Verenestra lived in the Seelie Court, where she had her own bower. The Seelie Court itself was known to wander the planes of [[Ysgard]], [[Arborea]], and the [[Beastlands]].<ref>

Verenestra's bower was a place of silver birches, larchs, and plane trees, with willows of the fringe, all of which were decorated with silver filigree and jewels. She kept many mirrors within with which to admire herself.
document_data.Activities: Verenestra rarely left her bower in the Seelie Court, but occasionally left to abduct a particularly charismatic man. At other times, she would accompany other fey deities when a matter of mutual interest was involved.
document_data.Relationships: Verenestra was one of the daughters of [[Titania]], and was presumably the sister, or half-sister, of [[Damh]] and the [[Prince of Frost]].<ref>

Worshipers.Symbol: Verenestra's holy symbol was a filigree-edged silver mirror.
